greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of binary carry-connected subsets of [n] containing n (for n > 0).
comment: Two integers are binary carry-connected if their bitwise AND is not zero.
For n = 0 the carry-connected subset is the empty set.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1024
maple: h:= proc(n, s) local i, m; m:= n;
for i in s do m:= Bits[Or](m, i) od; {m}
g:= (n, s)-> (w-> `if`(w={}, s union {n}, s minus w union
mathematica: h[n_, s_] := Module[{i, m = n}, Do[m = BitOr[m, i], {i, s}]; {m}];
g[n_, s_] := Function[w, If[w == {}, s ~Union~ {n}, s ~Complement~ w ~Union~ h[n, w]]][Select[s, BitAnd[n, #] > 0&]];
a /@ Range[0, 42] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 10 2020, after Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 31 2019
